intro: Mikania monzonensis, commonly known as the Mexican vine, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense mats, which can make it a weed in agricultural settings. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
